item.title: Geo raster data parsing with rasterio
item.description: There are two main ways geospatial data are stored rasters, where each ‘pixel’ stores data values. This corresponds to files such as geotiffs. vectors, where information is stored more like a table form, and each row will have a ‘geometry’ field which stores information that allows you to recreate a geographical feature, such as a point , a polygon etc. It might also store the coordinate reference system so you can correctly place the shapes on a map This set of notes corresponds to handling raster data.
